title: nnSVG tutorial
text: nnSVG method scalable identification spatially variable genes (SVGs) spatially-resolved transcriptomics data. nnSVG method based nearest-neighbor Gaussian processes (Datta et al., 2016, Finley et al., 2019) uses BRISC algorithm (Saha Datta, 2018) model fitting parameter estimation. nnSVG allows identification ranking SVGs flexible length scales across tissue slide within spatial domains defined covariates. method scales linearly number spatial locations can applied datasets containing thousands spatial locations. nnSVG implemented R package within Bioconductor framework, available Bioconductor. details describing method available preprint, available bioRxiv.

title: nnSVG tutorial
text: following code install latest release version nnSVG package Bioconductor. Additional details shown Bioconductor page. latest development version can also installed devel version Bioconductor GitHub.

title: nnSVG tutorial
text: examples , assume input data provided SpatialExperiment Bioconductor object. case, outputs stored rowData SpatialExperiment object. However, inputs can also provided numeric matrix normalized transformed counts (e.g. log-transformed normalized counts, also known logcounts) numeric matrix spatial coordinates. provide inputs numeric matrices, please install development version package GitHub devel version Bioconductor (become new Bioconductor release version October 2022).

title: nnSVG tutorial
text: show short example demonstrating run nnSVG. faster runtime example, subsample dataset run nnSVG small number genes. full analysis, subsampling step can skipped.
code: library(SpatialExperiment) library(STexampleData) library(scran) library(nnSVG) library(ggplot2) # load example dataset from STexampleData package spe <- Visium_humanDLPFC()  dim(spe) ## [1] 33538  4992 # preprocessing steps  # keep only spots over tissue spe <- spe[, colData(spe)$in_tissue == 1] dim(spe) ## [1] 33538  3639 # skip spot-level quality control, since this has been performed previously  # on this dataset  # filter low-expressed and mitochondrial genes # using default filtering parameters spe <- filter_genes(spe) ## Gene filtering: removing mitochondrial genes ## removed 13 mitochondrial genes ## Gene filtering: retaining genes with at least 3 counts in at least 0.5% (n = 19) of spatial locations ## removed 30216 out of 33525 genes due to low expression # calculate logcounts (log-transformed normalized counts) using scran package # using library size factors spe <- computeLibraryFactors(spe) spe <- logNormCounts(spe)  assayNames(spe) ## [1] "counts"    "logcounts" # select small set of random genes and several known SVGs for  # faster runtime in this example set.seed(123) ix_random <- sample(seq_len(nrow(spe)), 10)  known_genes <- c("MOBP", "PCP4", "SNAP25", "HBB", "IGKC", "NPY") ix_known <- which(rowData(spe)$gene_name %in% known_genes)  ix <- c(ix_known, ix_random)  spe <- spe[ix, ] dim(spe) ## [1]   16 3639 # run nnSVG  # set seed for reproducibility set.seed(123) # using a single thread in this example spe <- nnSVG(spe)  # show results rowData(spe) ## DataFrame with 16 rows and 17 columns ##                         gene_id   gene_name    feature_type   sigma.sq ##                     <character> <character>     <character>  <numeric> ## ENSG00000211592 ENSG00000211592        IGKC Gene Expression   0.565595 ## ENSG00000168314 ENSG00000168314        MOBP Gene Expression   1.387394 ## ENSG00000122585 ENSG00000122585         NPY Gene Expression   0.285674 ## ENSG00000244734 ENSG00000244734         HBB Gene Expression   0.329421 ## ENSG00000132639 ENSG00000132639      SNAP25 Gene Expression   0.430040 ## ...                         ...         ...             ...        ... ## ENSG00000130382 ENSG00000130382       MLLT1 Gene Expression 0.00978589 ## ENSG00000036672 ENSG00000036672        USP2 Gene Expression 0.00307278 ## ENSG00000086232 ENSG00000086232     EIF2AK1 Gene Expression 0.00315783 ## ENSG00000106278 ENSG00000106278      PTPRZ1 Gene Expression 0.00279876 ## ENSG00000133606 ENSG00000133606       MKRN1 Gene Expression 0.00632243 ##                    tau.sq        phi    loglik   runtime      mean       var ##                 <numeric>  <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> ## ENSG00000211592  0.455044   20.10924  -4531.64     1.722  0.622937  1.007454 ## ENSG00000168314  0.364188    1.10202  -3663.60     1.010  0.805525  1.205673 ## ENSG00000122585  0.280173   71.65328  -3995.23     1.476  0.393975  0.567383 ## ENSG00000244734  0.353754   27.81410  -4044.96     2.290  0.411262  0.697673 ## ENSG00000132639  0.430106    3.03385  -3912.70     0.796  3.451926  0.857922 ## ...                   ...        ...       ...       ...       ...       ... ## ENSG00000130382  0.283114 50.9885795  -2927.61     1.165  0.298698  0.292976 ## ENSG00000036672  0.241105 12.5383403  -2597.00     0.800  0.248384  0.244218 ## ENSG00000086232  0.266973 25.9300370  -2781.47     0.792  0.275193  0.270208 ## ENSG00000106278  0.367893  9.5295370  -3357.32     0.934  0.352159  0.370784 ## ENSG00000133606  0.272432  0.0827146  -2831.51     1.079  0.295404  0.278806 ##                     spcov    prop_sv loglik_lm   LR_stat      rank        pval ##                 <numeric>  <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric>   <numeric> ## ENSG00000211592  1.207283   0.554158  -5176.53  1289.775         3           0 ## ENSG00000168314  1.462248   0.792080  -5503.33  3679.464         1           0 ## ENSG00000122585  1.356646   0.504861  -4131.87   273.278         6           0 ## ENSG00000244734  1.395587   0.482191  -4507.99   926.046         4           0 ## ENSG00000132639  0.189973   0.499961  -4884.19  1942.986         2           0 ## ...                   ...        ...       ...       ...       ...         ... ## ENSG00000130382  0.331183 0.03341030  -2929.28   3.35215        12 0.187106591 ## ENSG00000036672  0.223173 0.01258418  -2598.08   2.15483        13 0.340474000 ## ENSG00000086232  0.204201 0.01169003  -2782.09   1.23716        14 0.538708435 ## ENSG00000106278  0.150226 0.00755009  -3357.83   1.01109        15 0.603178095 ## ENSG00000133606  0.269170 0.02268102  -2839.08  15.15227         9 0.000512539 ##                        padj ##                   <numeric> ## ENSG00000211592           0 ## ENSG00000168314           0 ## ENSG00000122585           0 ## ENSG00000244734           0 ## ENSG00000132639           0 ## ...                     ... ## ENSG00000130382 0.249475454 ## ENSG00000036672 0.419044923 ## ENSG00000086232 0.615666783 ## ENSG00000106278 0.643389968 ## ENSG00000133606 0.000911181

title: nnSVG tutorial
text: results stored rowData SpatialExperiment object. main results interest : LR_stat: likelihood ratio (LR) statistics rank: rank top SVGs according LR statistics pval: p-values asymptotic chi-squared distribution 2 degrees freedom padj: p-values adjusted multiple testing, can used define cutoff statistically significant SVGs (e.g. padj <= 0.05) prop_sv: effect size, defined proportion spatial variance total variance

title: nnSVG tutorial
text: nnSVG can also run datasets known covariates, spatial domains cell types. case, method identify SVGs within regions defined selected covariates, e.g. within spatial domains. run short example demonstrating functionality. , faster runtime example, subsample small subset data. full analysis, subsampling step can skipped. Note empty levels factor used create design matrix, can removed follows:
code: library(SpatialExperiment) library(STexampleData) library(scran) library(nnSVG) library(ggplot2) # load example dataset from STexampleData package spe <- SlideSeqV2_mouseHPC()  dim(spe) ## [1] 23264 53208 # preprocessing steps  # remove spots with NA cell type labels spe <- spe[, !is.na(colData(spe)$celltype)] dim(spe) ## [1] 23264 15003 # check cell type labels table(colData(spe)$celltype) ##  ##             Astrocyte                   CA1                   CA3  ##                  6688                  1320                  1729  ##         Cajal_Retzius               Choroid                Denate  ##                    60                    21                  1713  ##     Endothelial_Stalk       Endothelial_Tip           Entorihinal  ##                    96                   118                   111  ##             Ependymal           Interneuron Microglia_Macrophages  ##                    94                   730                   299  ##                 Mural          Neurogenesis        Neuron.Slc17a6  ##                    26                    47                    44  ##       Oligodendrocyte        Polydendrocyte  ##                  1793                   114 # filter low-expressed and mitochondrial genes # using adjusted filtering parameters for this platform spe <- filter_genes(   spe,    filter_genes_ncounts = 1,    filter_genes_pcspots = 1,    filter_mito = TRUE ) ## Gene filtering: removing mitochondrial genes ## removed 25 mitochondrial genes ## Gene filtering: retaining genes with at least 1 counts in at least 1% (n = 151) of spatial locations ## removed 14356 out of 23239 genes due to low expression dim(spe) ## [1]  8883 15003 # calculate log-transformed normalized counts using scran package # using library size normalization spe <- computeLibraryFactors(spe) spe <- logNormCounts(spe)  assayNames(spe) ## [1] "counts"    "logcounts" # select small set of random genes and several known SVGs for  # faster runtime in this example set.seed(123) ix_random <- sample(seq_len(nrow(spe)), 10)  known_genes <- c("Cpne9", "Rgs14") ix_known <- which(rowData(spe)$gene_name %in% known_genes)  ix <- c(ix_known, ix_random)  spe <- spe[ix, ] dim(spe) ## [1]    12 15003 # run nnSVG with covariates  # create model matrix for cell type labels X <- model.matrix(~ colData(spe)$celltype) dim(X) ## [1] 15003    17 stopifnot(nrow(X) == ncol(spe))  # set seed for reproducibility set.seed(123) # using a single thread in this example spe <- nnSVG(spe, X = X)  # show results rowData(spe) ## DataFrame with 12 rows and 15 columns ##          gene_name    sigma.sq    tau.sq         phi    loglik   runtime ##        <character>   <numeric> <numeric>   <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> ## Cpne9        Cpne9 6.91466e-04 0.0275984 1.28473e+01   5484.78    12.724 ## Rgs14        Rgs14 2.77108e-03 0.0452678 1.05096e-04   1650.39    12.293 ## Eogt          Eogt 8.52221e-05 0.0198481 7.81774e+01   8083.08     7.012 ## Ergic1      Ergic1 2.54392e-04 0.0465677 9.77178e+01   1677.16     6.505 ## Zfp330      Zfp330 1.21718e-04 0.0266163 1.54155e+02   5879.76     6.634 ## ...            ...         ...       ...         ...       ...       ... ## Hdac11      Hdac11 3.54427e-03 0.1648233    145.3031  -7920.47     9.401 ## Nab2          Nab2 3.99610e-05 0.0145549     67.5457  10421.32     7.017 ## Senp3        Senp3 7.97630e-05 0.0253771     36.8091   6248.29     7.629 ## Fbxo6        Fbxo6 9.53681e-05 0.0253767    168.3954   6243.54     7.147 ## Ntng1        Ntng1 2.39135e-03 0.0433036     24.1537   1951.83     8.787 ##             mean       var     spcov    prop_sv loglik_lm    LR_stat      rank ##        <numeric> <numeric> <numeric>  <numeric> <numeric>  <numeric> <numeric> ## Cpne9  0.0194924 0.0283971  1.349024 0.02444221   5455.66   58.23907         3 ## Rgs14  0.0360053 0.0485672  1.462036 0.05768411   1515.16  270.46142         1 ## Eogt   0.0125243 0.0200072  0.737094 0.00427535   8082.32    1.52761         6 ## Ergic1 0.0359343 0.0471421  0.443857 0.00543316   1676.61    1.10862         8 ## Zfp330 0.0201203 0.0267799  0.548332 0.00455227   5879.05    1.42306         7 ## ...          ...       ...       ...        ...       ...        ...       ... ## Hdac11 0.1258726 0.1705333  0.472969 0.02105081  -7923.51   6.072536         4 ## Nab2   0.0120832 0.0146742  0.523161 0.00273802  10421.82  -1.016734        12 ## Senp3  0.0199706 0.0255396  0.447208 0.00313326   6248.60  -0.631543        11 ## Fbxo6  0.0188249 0.0255584  0.518763 0.00374402   6243.59  -0.103396        10 ## Ntng1  0.0341843 0.0466474  1.430523 0.05233292   1854.40 194.856131         2 ##               pval        padj ##          <numeric>   <numeric> ## Cpne9  2.25708e-13 9.02833e-13 ## Rgs14  0.00000e+00 0.00000e+00 ## Eogt   4.65891e-01 8.41529e-01 ## Ergic1 5.74469e-01 8.61704e-01 ## Zfp330 4.90892e-01 8.41529e-01 ## ...            ...         ... ## Hdac11   0.0480137    0.144041 ## Nab2     1.0000000    1.000000 ## Senp3    1.0000000    1.000000 ## Fbxo6    1.0000000    1.000000 ## Ntng1    0.0000000    0.000000 # create model matrix after dropping empty factor levels X <- model.matrix(~ droplevels(as.factor(colData(spe)$celltype)))

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lukas M. Weber. Author, maintainer. Stephanie C. Hicks. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Weber et al. (2022), nnSVG: scalable identification spatially variable genes using nearest-neighbor Gaussian processes, bioRxiv.
code: @Article{,   title = {nnSVG: scalable identification of spatially variable genes using nearest-neighbor Gaussian processes},   author = {Lukas M. Weber and Arkajyoti Saha and Abhirup Datta and Kasper D. Hansen and Stephanie C. Hicks},   journal = {bioRxiv},   year = {2022},   doi = {https://doi.org/10.1101/2022.05.16.492124}, }

title:
Scalable identification of spatially variable genes in 
    spatially-resolved transcriptomics data
text: nnSVG method scalable identification spatially variable genes (SVGs) spatially-resolved transcriptomics data. nnSVG method based nearest-neighbor Gaussian processes (Datta et al., 2016, Finley et al., 2019) uses BRISC algorithm (Saha Datta, 2018) model fitting parameter estimation. nnSVG allows identification ranking SVGs flexible length scales across tissue slide within spatial domains defined covariates. method scales linearly number spatial locations can applied datasets containing thousands spatial locations. nnSVG implemented R package within Bioconductor framework, available Bioconductor. preprint describing method available bioRxiv.

title:
Scalable identification of spatially variable genes in 
    spatially-resolved transcriptomics data
text: package can installed Bioconductor follows, using R version 4.2 : Alternatively, latest development version package can also installed GitHub: installing GitHub, following dependency packages may also need installed manually Bioconductor CRAN:
code: install.packages("BiocManager") BiocManager::install("nnSVG") remotes::install_github("lmweber/nnSVG") install.packages("BiocManager") BiocManager::install("SpatialExperiment") BiocManager::install("STexampleData") install.packages("BRISC")

title:
Scalable identification of spatially variable genes in 
    spatially-resolved transcriptomics data
text: examples , assume input data provided SpatialExperiment Bioconductor object. case, outputs stored rowData SpatialExperiment object. However, inputs can also provided numeric matrix normalized transformed counts (e.g. log-transformed normalized counts, also known logcounts) numeric matrix spatial coordinates. provide inputs numeric matrices, please install development version package GitHub devel version Bioconductor (become new Bioconductor release version October 2022).

title:
Scalable identification of spatially variable genes in 
    spatially-resolved transcriptomics data
text: example workflow provided package vignette Bioconductor shown short form. Load packages Load example dataset Preprocessing Subset data example Run nnSVG Investigate results results stored rowData SpatialExperiment object. main results interest : LR_stat: likelihood ratio (LR) statistics used rank SVGs rank: rank top SVGs according LR statistics pval: approximate p-values padj: approximate p-values adjusted multiple testing prop_sv: effect size defined proportion spatial variance Plot expression top SVG Plot expression top-ranked SVG.
code: library(nnSVG) library(STexampleData) library(scran) library(ggplot2) # load example dataset from STexampleData package spe <- Visium_humanDLPFC() dim(spe) ## [1] 33538  4992 # keep spots over tissue spe <- spe[, colData(spe)$in_tissue == 1] dim(spe) ## [1] 33538  3639 # spot-level quality control: already performed on this example dataset # filter low-expressed and mitochondrial genes # using function from nnSVG package with default filtering parameters spe <- filter_genes(spe) ## Gene filtering: removing mitochondrial genes ## removed 13 mitochondrial genes ## Gene filtering: retaining genes with at least 3 counts in at least 0.5% (n = 19) of spatial locations ## removed 30216 out of 33525 genes due to low expression # calculate logcounts (log-transformed normalized counts) using scran package # using library size factors spe <- computeLibraryFactors(spe) spe <- logNormCounts(spe) assayNames(spe) ## [1] "counts"    "logcounts" # select small set of random genes and several known SVGs for faster runtime in this example workflow set.seed(123) ix_random <- sample(seq_len(nrow(spe)), 10) known_genes <- c("MOBP", "PCP4", "SNAP25", "HBB", "IGKC", "NPY") ix_known <- which(rowData(spe)$gene_name %in% known_genes) ix <- c(ix_known, ix_random)  spe <- spe[ix, ] dim(spe) ## [1]   16 3639 # set seed for reproducibility # run nnSVG using a single thread for this example workflow set.seed(123) spe <- nnSVG(spe, n_threads = 1)  # show results rowData(spe) ## DataFrame with 16 rows and 17 columns ## [...] # number of significant SVGs table(rowData(spe)$padj <= 0.05) ##  ## FALSE  TRUE  ##     7     9 # show results for top n SVGs n <- 10 rowData(spe)[order(rowData(spe)$rank)[1:n], ] ## DataFrame with 10 rows and 17 columns ##                         gene_id   gene_name    feature_type   sigma.sq    tau.sq ##                     <character> <character>     <character>  <numeric> <numeric> ## ENSG00000168314 ENSG00000168314        MOBP Gene Expression 1.38739383  0.364188 ## ENSG00000132639 ENSG00000132639      SNAP25 Gene Expression 0.43003959  0.430106 ## ENSG00000211592 ENSG00000211592        IGKC Gene Expression 0.56564845  0.455042 ## ENSG00000244734 ENSG00000244734         HBB Gene Expression 0.32942113  0.353754 ## ENSG00000183036 ENSG00000183036        PCP4 Gene Expression 0.23102220  0.452735 ## ENSG00000122585 ENSG00000122585         NPY Gene Expression 0.28567359  0.280173 ## ENSG00000129562 ENSG00000129562        DAD1 Gene Expression 0.02389607  0.464723 ## ENSG00000114923 ENSG00000114923      SLC4A3 Gene Expression 0.01147170  0.237260 ## ENSG00000133606 ENSG00000133606       MKRN1 Gene Expression 0.00632248  0.272432 ## ENSG00000143543 ENSG00000143543         JTB Gene Expression 0.07541566  0.463623 ##                        phi    loglik   runtime      mean       var     spcov ##                  <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> ## ENSG00000168314   1.102018  -3663.60     0.631  0.805525  1.205673  1.462248 ## ENSG00000132639   3.033847  -3912.70     0.450  3.451926  0.857922  0.189973 ## ENSG00000211592  20.107022  -4531.64     1.054  0.622937  1.007454  1.207340 ## ENSG00000244734  27.814098  -4044.96     1.559  0.411262  0.697673  1.395587 ## ENSG00000183036   8.272278  -4026.22     0.419  0.687961  0.684598  0.698656 ## ENSG00000122585  71.653290  -3995.23     0.843  0.393975  0.567383  1.356646 ## ENSG00000129562  10.141894  -3842.24     0.590  0.549318  0.489167  0.281410 ## ENSG00000114923  12.765645  -2617.36     0.658  0.250768  0.248816  0.427112 ## ENSG00000133606   0.082764  -2831.51     0.612  0.295404  0.278806  0.269171 ## ENSG00000143543 119.721419  -4036.28     0.731  0.654919  0.539172  0.419318 ##                   prop_sv loglik_lm    LR_stat      rank        pval        padj ##                 <numeric> <numeric>  <numeric> <numeric>   <numeric>   <numeric> ## ENSG00000168314 0.7920804  -5503.33 3679.46397         1 0.00000e+00 0.00000e+00 ## ENSG00000132639 0.4999614  -4884.19 1942.98556         2 0.00000e+00 0.00000e+00 ## ENSG00000211592 0.5541822  -5176.53 1289.77508         3 0.00000e+00 0.00000e+00 ## ENSG00000244734 0.4821910  -4507.99  926.04573         4 0.00000e+00 0.00000e+00 ## ENSG00000114923 0.0461207  -2632.02   29.31376         8 4.31119e-07 8.62238e-07 ## ENSG00000133606 0.0226812  -2839.08   15.15227         9 5.12539e-04 9.11181e-04 ## ENSG00000143543 0.1399077  -4039.07    5.59664        10 6.09124e-02 9.74599e-02 # plot spatial expression of top-ranked SVG ix <- which(rowData(spe)$rank == 1) ix_name <- rowData(spe)$gene_name[ix] ix_name ## [1] "MOBP" df <- as.data.frame(cbind(spatialCoords(spe), expr = counts(spe)[ix, ]))  ggplot(df, aes(x = pxl_col_in_fullres, y = pxl_row_in_fullres,                 color = expr)) +    geom_point(size = 0.8) +    coord_fixed() +    scale_y_reverse() +    scale_color_gradient(low = "gray90", high = "blue",                         trans = "sqrt", breaks = range(df$expr),                         name = "counts") +    ggtitle(ix_name) +    theme_bw() +    theme(plot.title = element_text(face = "italic"),          panel.grid = element_blank(),          axis.title = element_blank(),          axis.text = element_blank(),          axis.ticks = element_blank())

title:
Scalable identification of spatially variable genes in 
    spatially-resolved transcriptomics data
text: preprint describing nnSVG available bioRxiv: Weber L.M. et al. (2022), “nnSVG: scalable identification spatially variable genes using nearest-neighbor Gaussian processes”, bioRxiv

what: Preprocessing function to filter genes — filter_genes
title: Preprocessing function to filter genes — filter_genes
text: Preprocessing function filter low-expressed genes /mitochondrial genes 'nnSVG'.

title: Preprocessing function to filter genes — filter_genes
code: filter_genes(   spe,   filter_genes_ncounts = 3,   filter_genes_pcspots = 0.5,   filter_mito = TRUE )

title: Preprocessing function to filter genes — filter_genes
text: spe SpatialExperiment: Input data, assumed formatted SpatialExperiment object assay slot named counts containing raw expression counts. filter_genes_ncounts numeric: Filtering parameter low-expressed genes. Filtering retains genes containing least filter_genes_ncounts expression counts least filter_genes_pcspots percent total number spatial locations (spots). Defaults: filter_genes_ncounts = 3, filter_genes_pcspots = 0.5, .e. keep genes least 3 counts least 0.5 percent spots. Set NULL disable. filter_genes_pcspots numeric: Second filtering parameter low-expressed genes. Set NULL disable. See filter_genes_ncounts details. filter_mito logical: Whether filter mitochondrial genes, identified gene names starting "MT" "mt". requires rowData slot input object contains column named gene_name. Default = TRUE. Set FALSE disable.

title: Preprocessing function to filter genes — filter_genes
text: Returns SpatialExperiment filtered genes (rows) removed.

title: Preprocessing function to filter genes — filter_genes
text: Preprocessing function filter low-expressed genes /mitochondrial genes 'nnSVG'. function can used filter low-expressed genes /mitochondrial genes additional preprocessing (calculating logcounts deviance residuals) running 'nnSVG'. use function examples vignettes 'nnSVG' package, provide default filtering parameter values appropriate 10x Genomics Visium data. use function optional. Users can also perform filtering preprocessing separately, run nnSVG preprocessed SpatialExperiment object.

title: Preprocessing function to filter genes — filter_genes

title: nnSVG — nnSVG
text: Function run 'nnSVG' method identify spatially variable genes (SVGs) spatially-resolved transcriptomics data.

title: nnSVG — nnSVG
code: nnSVG(   input,   spatial_coords = NULL,   X = NULL,   assay_name = "logcounts",   n_neighbors = 10,   order = "AMMD",   n_threads = 1,   BPPARAM = NULL,   verbose = FALSE )

title: nnSVG — nnSVG
text: input SpatialExperiment numeric matrix: Input data, can either SpatialExperiment object numeric matrix values. SpatialExperiment object, assumed assay slot containing either logcounts (e.g. scran package) deviance residuals (e.g. scry package), spatialCoords slot containing spatial coordinates measurements. numeric matrix, values assumed already normalized transformed (e.g. logcounts), formatted rows = genes columns = spots, separate numeric matrix spatial coordinates must also provided spatial_coords argument. spatial_coords numeric matrix: Matrix containing columns spatial coordinates, formatted rows = spots. must provided input provied numeric matrix values, ignored input provided SpatialExperiment object. Default = NULL. X numeric matrix: Optional design matrix containing columns covariates per spatial location, e.g. known spatial domains. Number rows must match number spatial locations. Default = NULL, fits intercept-model. assay_name character: input provided SpatialExperiment object, argument selects name assay slot input object containing preprocessed gene expression values. example, logcounts log-transformed normalized counts scran package, binomial_deviance_residuals deviance residuals scry package. Default = "logcounts", ignored input provided numeric matrix values. n_neighbors integer: Number nearest neighbors fitting nearest-neighbor Gaussian process (NNGP) model BRISC. default value 10, recommend datasets. Higher numbers (e.g. 15) may give slightly improved likelihood estimates datasets (expense slower runtime), smaller numbers (e.g. 5) give faster runtime (expense reduced performance). Default = 10. order character: Ordering scheme use ordering coordinates BRISC. Default = "AMMD" "approximate maximum minimum distance", recommended datasets least 65 spots. small datasets (n <= 65), "Sum_coords" can used instead. See BRISC documentation details. Default = "AMMD". n_threads integer: Number threads parallelization. Default = 1. recommend setting equal number cores available (working laptop desktop) around 10 (working compute cluster). BPPARAM BiocParallelParam: Optional additional argument parallelization. argument provided advanced users BiocParallel flexibility parallelization operating systems. provided, instance BiocParallelParam. users, recommended option use n_threads argument instead. Default = NULL, case n_threads used instead. verbose logical: Whether display verbose output model fitting parameter estimation BRISC. Default = FALSE.

title: nnSVG — nnSVG
text: input provided SpatialExperiment object,   output values returned additional columns rowData slot   input object. input provided numeric matrix   values, output returned numeric matrix. output   values include spatial variance parameter estimates, likelihood ratio (LR)   statistics, effect sizes (proportion spatial variance), p-values,   multiple testing adjusted p-values.

title: nnSVG — nnSVG
text: Function run 'nnSVG' method identify spatially variable genes (SVGs) spatially-resolved transcriptomics data. 'nnSVG' method based nearest-neighbor Gaussian processes (Datta et al. 2016) uses BRISC algorithm (Saha Datta 2018) model fitting parameter estimation. method scales linearly number spatial locations, can applied datasets containing thousands spatial locations. details method, see paper. function runs 'nnSVG' full dataset. function fits separate model gene, using parallelization BiocParallel faster runtime. parameter estimates BRISC (sigma.sq, tau.sq, phi) gene stored 'Theta' BRISC output. 'nnSVG' performs inference spatial variance parameter estimates (sigma.sq) using likelihood ratio (LR) test simpler linear model without spatial terms (.e. without tau.sq phi). estimated LR statistics can used rank SVGs. P-values calculated LR statistics using asymptotic chi-squared distribution 2 degrees freedom, multiple testing adjusted p-values calculated using Benjamini-Hochberg method. also calculate effect size, defined proportion spatial variance, 'prop_sv = sigma.sq / (sigma.sq + tau.sq)'. function assumes input provided either SpatialExperiment object numeric matrix values. input SpatialExperiment object, assumed contain assay slot containing either log-transformed normalized counts (also known logcounts, e.g. scran package) deviance residuals (e.g. scry package), preprocessed, quality controlled, filtered remove low-quality spatial locations. input numeric matrix values, values assumed already normalized transformed (e.g. logcounts).

title: nnSVG — nnSVG
code: library(SpatialExperiment) library(STexampleData) library(scran) #> Loading required package: scuttle  # load example dataset from STexampleData package spe <- Visium_humanDLPFC()  # preprocessing steps  # keep only spots over tissue spe <- spe[, colData(spe)$in_tissue == 1]  # skip spot-level quality control, since this has been performed previously  # on this dataset  # filter low-expressed and mitochondrial genes spe <- filter_genes(spe) #> Gene filtering: removing mitochondrial genes #> removed 13 mitochondrial genes #> Gene filtering: retaining genes with at least 3 counts in at least 0.5% (n = 19) of spatial locations #> removed 30216 out of 33525 genes due to low expression  # calculate logcounts (log-transformed normalized counts) using scran package # using library size factors spe <- computeLibraryFactors(spe) spe <- logNormCounts(spe)  # select small number of genes for faster runtime in this example set.seed(123) ix <- sample(seq_len(nrow(spe)), 4) spe <- spe[ix, ]  # run nnSVG set.seed(123) spe <- nnSVG(spe)  # show results # for more details see extended example in vignette rowData(spe) #> DataFrame with 4 rows and 17 columns #>                         gene_id   gene_name    feature_type   sigma.sq #>                     <character> <character>     <character>  <numeric> #> ENSG00000167965 ENSG00000167965       MLST8 Gene Expression 0.00171144 #> ENSG00000149923 ENSG00000149923       PPP4C Gene Expression 0.07053510 #> ENSG00000129562 ENSG00000129562        DAD1 Gene Expression 0.02389607 #> ENSG00000114923 ENSG00000114923      SLC4A3 Gene Expression 0.01147169 #>                    tau.sq       phi    loglik   runtime      mean       var #>                 <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> #> ENSG00000167965  0.298324   75.1140  -2973.08     0.791  0.309071  0.300081 #> ENSG00000149923  0.172327  169.6705  -2585.84     1.341  0.232806  0.242920 #> ENSG00000129562  0.464723   10.1419  -3842.24     0.997  0.549318  0.489167 #> ENSG00000114923  0.237260   12.7656  -2617.36     1.135  0.250768  0.248816 #>                     spcov    prop_sv loglik_lm   LR_stat      rank        pval #>                 <numeric>  <numeric> <numeric> <numeric> <numeric>   <numeric> #> ENSG00000167965  0.133851 0.00570411  -2972.88 -0.403889         4 1.00000e+00 #> ENSG00000149923  1.140796 0.29043215  -2588.38  5.096502         3 7.82183e-02 #> ENSG00000129562  0.281410 0.04890529  -3861.98 39.490976         1 2.65854e-09 #> ENSG00000114923  0.427112 0.04612068  -2632.02 29.313762         2 4.31119e-07 #>                        padj #>                   <numeric> #> ENSG00000167965 1.00000e+00 #> ENSG00000149923 1.04291e-01 #> ENSG00000129562 1.06342e-08 #> ENSG00000114923 8.62238e-07
